bug.author: CESARDELATORRE
bug.summary: Notebook aml-pipelines-with-automated-machine-learning-step.ipynb throws errors and it's partially outdated
bug.description:
This notebook was updated to version 1.2.0 and when running it, its pipeline training works. However, part of it right at the end of the notebook is throwing errors: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1712635/77794395-0babcd00-7029-11ea-8fad-575ae070eb61.png></denchmark-link>
Plus it needs to be updated so there are no warnings about APIs parameters being deprecated: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1712635/77795629-24b57d80-702b-11ea-9b70-c40bdde39814.png></denchmark-link>
Also still talking about "" but should be "COMPUTE INSTANCE": ...If you are using an Azure Machine Learning **Notebook VM**... I'll make sure this is fixed. I'll work on it.

comments.comment: This notebook is already updated internally, we need to publish it in GitHub, here.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/CESARDELATORRE>@CESARDELATORRE</denchmark-link> Thank you Cesar, I have assigned this issue to the author. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sanpil>@sanpil</denchmark-link> Could you please check this issue? Thanks.
